intro: Cyrtosperma timikense, commonly known as the Timor moonseed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and Papua New Guinea. The plant is characterized by its palm-like appearance, with a stout, unbranched stem and large, pinnate leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces a distinctive, fleshy fruit with a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
